description: Independent Bitcoin Core [contributor](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/graphs/contributors) focusing on security. Found [CVE-2017-18350](https://medium.com/@lukedashjr/cve-2017-18350-disclosure-fe6d695f45d5), [CVE-2018-20586](https://medium.com/@lukedashjr/cve-2018-20586-disclosure-ff3e1ab9a21f), [CVE-2019-18936](https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2019/CVE-2019-18936.html) and some fixed but yet to be announced vulns. Plans to help Bitcoin stay secure for decades to come by a.) killing bugs ([auditing/fuzzing](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls?q=is%3Amerged+is%3Apr+author%3Apracticalswift+fuzz+OR+fuzzer+OR+fuzzing)), b.) killing bug classes (mitigations), c.) improving security processes ([tooling/automation](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls?q=is%3Amerged+is%3Apr+author%3Apracticalswift+sanitizer+OR+ASan+OR+MSan+OR+UBSan+OR+TSan+OR+diagnostics)) and d.) raising C++ secure coding awareness (education/review). Loyal to Bitcoiners *only*: not to corporations or cliques. Trying to stay 100% independent. See GitHub profile for HODL-only donation address :)
name: practicalswift
